faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: What happens if a person in the UAE dies without registering a Will?
items.answer: Without a will, all assets and investments of a person who passes away are disbursed according to the Shariah Law. Our expert consultants streamline the drafting and registering process to protect your legacy.

items.question: Do expats need to create a Will in the UAE?
items.answer: Yes, you’ll need a registered, legally compliant Will in Dubai to ensure your real estate, bank accounts, and assets fall into the right hands.

items.question: What is the difference between a DIFC and an ADJD Will?
items.answer: DIFC Wills are registered and recognised by the DIFC Courts and are ideal for non-Muslim expats with assets in Dubai or Ras Al Khaimah, whereas ADJD is well-suited for folks across the rest of the UAE.

items.question: What happens to bank accounts when somebody passes away?
items.answer: The UAE’s regulatory bodies will freeze a bank account instantly after a person passes away and release it only after the court conducts a stringent probate process.

items.question: Can I include international or digital assets in my UAE Will?
items.answer: Yes, with our expert consultants, you can register Wills that cover international real estate, crypto assets, and other digital holdings.
